meanings.definition: Join, fasten, or repair (something) by making stitches with a needle and thread.
meanings.sent1: I will sew the torn shirt back together.
meanings.sent2: She likes to sew buttons onto her coat.
meanings.sent3: The tailor had to sew up the hole in the pants.
meanings.sent4: Her words sewed doubt in his mind.
meanings.sent5: The seamstress skillfully sewed intricate patterns on the dress.

meanings.definition: To work with a needle and thread or with a sewing machine.
meanings.sent1: Grandma will sew a quilt for me.
meanings.sent2: I need to sew a new hem on my skirt.
meanings.sent3: He tried to sew a button but it fell off.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship sewed them together like a strong thread.
meanings.sent5: The tailor can sew quickly and accurately with his machine.

meanings.definition: To make or repair clothes or other items by joining them together with stitches.
meanings.sent1: I will sew a new dress for the party.
meanings.sent2: She can sew a patch on her backpack.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to sew a leaf onto its nest.
meanings.sent4: Their shared experiences sewed them into a close-knit group.
meanings.sent5: The costume designer can sew elaborate costumes in no time.
